questions.text: A passive electrical component is one that:

choices.text: Consumes or stores energy but does not generate it
Requires a power source to function

questions.text: Thevenin's theorem can be applied to a circuit containing:
In a star (Y) connected three-phase system, the line voltage is related to the phase voltage by:
A Light Emitting Diode (LED) emits light when it is:
For an ideal op-amp, which of the following is assumed to be true?
A power amplifier is primarily designed to:

choices.text: Deliver a large amount of power to a load
Have a very high input impedance

questions.text: The primary purpose of a Karnaugh Map (K-map) is to:
A circuit that can store one bit of information is a:
A synchronous counter is faster than an asynchronous (ripple) counter because:

choices.text: It does not have a clock signal.
All flip-flops are triggered by the same clock signal simultaneously.

questions.text: The instruction set architecture (ISA) of a CPU defines:

choices.text: The physical size of the processor.
The set of instructions, registers, and memory addressing modes that the processor can execute.
The clock speed of the processor.
The manufacturing process of the CPU.

questions.text: Which of the following is a parallel communication interface?
In C, what does the typedef keyword do?

choices.text: It creates a new data type.
It gives an existing data type a new name (alias).

questions.text: In C++, what is a "template"?

choices.text: A pre-written class that can be used directly.
A feature that allows functions and classes to operate with generic types.

questions.text: Standard Template Library (STL) in C++ provides a collection of:
The ALU (Arithmetic Logic Unit) of a CPU performs:

choices.text: Arithmetic operations (like addition, subtraction) and logical operations (like AND, OR).

questions.text: Cache "coherence" is a problem that occurs in:

choices.text: Systems with only one level of cache.
Multiprocessor systems where each processor has its own cache.

questions.text: Which of the following is a key requirement for a hard real-time system?
The primary difference between a hub and a switch is that a switch:

choices.text: Broadcasts incoming packets to all of its ports.
Forwards packets only to the intended destination port based on the MAC address.

questions.text: What is the function of DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol)?

choices.text: To resolve domain names to IP addresses.
To automatically assign IP addresses and other network configuration to devices.

questions.text: IPsec (Internet Protocol Security) operates at which layer of the OSI model?
A grammar is said to be "left-recursive" if it has a production rule of the form:
The "Halting Problem" in computation theory asks whether it is possible to determine, for an arbitrary program and input, if the program will:

choices.text: Finish running or continue to run forever

questions.text: Hidden surface removal in 3D computer graphics is the process of:

choices.text: Identifying and removing surfaces that are not visible from the viewer's perspective.

questions.text: In computer graphics, a "transformation matrix" is used to:

choices.text: Represent and combine geometric transformations like translation, rotation, and scaling.
Define the resolution of the display.
Store the vertices of a polygon.

questions.text: A "doubly linked list" has an advantage over a singly linked list in that it:

choices.text: Allows traversal in both forward and backward directions.
Searching for an element is faster.

questions.text: Which of the following is a characteristic of the Heap Sort algorithm?

choices.text: It has a time complexity of O(n²).
It is an in-place sorting algorithm with O(n log n) worst-case time complexity.

questions.text: What is the main purpose of the GROUP BY clause in an SQL query?

choices.text: To filter the results based on a condition.
To group rows that have the same values into summary rows.

questions.text: In operating systems, a "thread" is often described as a:
Validation in software engineering refers to:

choices.text: Checking if the system conforms to its specification.
Checking if the system meets the customer's actual needs and expectations.
The process of debugging the code.

questions.text: The "build and fix" model is a software development approach that is:

choices.text: Highly structured and recommended for large projects.
Characterized by writing some code, testing it, and then modifying it until it works.

questions.text: In a UML class diagram, the relationship between a class and an interface it implements is called:
The Single Responsibility Principle (SRP) of object-oriented design suggests that a class should have:

choices.text: Responsibility over a single part of the functionality, and that responsibility should be entirely encapsulated by the class.

questions.text: A "utility-based agent" in AI is an agent that:

choices.text: Acts based on simple condition-action rules.
Has goals and tries to achieve them.
Tries to maximize its own "happiness" or utility function.
Has a complete model of the world.

questions.text: First-Order Logic (FOL) is more expressive than propositional logic because it allows for:

choices.text: Statements that are only true or false.
The use of variables, quantifiers (for all, there exists), and relations.

questions.text: The process of adjusting the weights in a neural network based on the error in its output is called:
An "orthographic projection" is a type of parallel projection where the direction of projection is:

choices.text: Perpendicular to the plane of projection.
At a 45-degree angle to the plane of projection.

questions.text: The "Payback Period" method for investment appraisal is often criticized because it:

choices.text: Ignores the time value of money and cash flows after the payback period.
Always gives the same result as the NPV method.

questions.text: Resource smoothing is a project management technique that:

choices.text: Aims to achieve a more uniform level of resource usage without changing the project's critical path and completion date.
Adds more resources to critical tasks.
Extends the project duration to resolve resource conflicts.

questions.text: Which of the following would be considered a conflict of interest for an engineer serving as an expert witness?

choices.text: Having extensive experience in the subject matter.
Having a financial stake in the outcome of the case.
Being a member of the Nepal Engineers' Association.

questions.text: The "Nepal Engineering Council (Acts & Regulations)" are the legal framework that:

choices.text: Establishes the NEC and empowers it to regulate the engineering profession.
Defines the salary scales for engineers in Nepal.
Specifies the technical standards for all construction.
Governs the activities of the Nepal Engineers' Association.

questions.text: Active power in an AC circuit is the:

choices.text: Power that is stored and returned to the source by reactive components.
Total power, including real and reactive components.
Actual power that is consumed and converted into other forms of energy (like heat or work).
The product of voltage and current.

questions.text: A "small-signal model" of a transistor is used to:

choices.text: Analyze its behavior under large DC conditions.
Analyze its behavior for small AC signals superimposed on a DC operating point.

questions.text: A "race condition" can be avoided in sequential circuits by using:

choices.text: A proper clocking scheme (e.g., master-slave or edge-triggered flip-flops)

questions.text: The "page table" in a virtual memory system contains:

choices.text: The physical address of every process.
A mapping from virtual page numbers to physical frame numbers.
The actual data of the pages.
The list of processes waiting for memory.

questions.text: The difference between POP3 and IMAP for retrieving email is that IMAP:

choices.text: Deletes the email from the server after downloading.
Allows for managing emails in folders on the server.

questions.text: What is a "deterministic finite automaton" (DFA)?

choices.text: A finite automaton where for each state and input symbol, there is exactly one next state.
A finite automaton with a stack.
A finite automaton that can have multiple next states for a single input.
A finite automaton with a Turing tape.

questions.text: Kruskal's algorithm is another method for finding the:
In object-oriented programming, what is an "interface"?

choices.text: A class with a full implementation of all its methods.
A contract that defines a set of method signatures that a class must implement.
The user interface of an application.

questions.text: Feature extraction in machine learning is the process of:

choices.text: Selecting the most important features from an existing set.
Transforming raw data into a set of features that better represent the underlying problem.

questions.text: A "risk register" in project management is used to:

choices.text: List all the project team members.
Document identified risks, their analysis, and plans for responding to them.

questions.text: An RLC series circuit has R=8 Ω, XL=10 Ω, and XC=4 Ω. The power factor of the circuit is:
A "bus" in a computer system is a:

choices.text: Subsystem that transfers data between components.

questions.text: In C++, protected members of a base class are accessible in:

choices.text: The base class and its derived classes.

questions.text: What is "thrashing"?

choices.text: A high level of disk activity due to excessive paging.
A condition where a process is permanently blocked.
The execution of a process by the CPU.
A security attack on the operating system.

questions.text: The SMTP protocol is used to:

choices.text: Send email from a client to a server or between servers.

questions.text: A language is "recursively enumerable" if there is a Turing machine that:

choices.text: Accepts all strings in the language and halts, but may loop forever on strings not in the language.
Can decide whether any given string belongs to the language.

questions.text: The "waterfall model" is best suited for projects where:

choices.text: Requirements are well-understood and unlikely to change.
The project is small and experimental.
The customer wants to see frequent updates.

questions.text: A "goal-based agent" differs from a reflex agent because it:

choices.text: Acts based on its current perception.
Has information about the results of its possible actions and can choose actions to achieve a goal.

questions.text: Slack or float in project scheduling is the amount of time that a task can be:

choices.text: Delayed without causing a delay to subsequent tasks or the project completion date.

questions.text: What is a key feature of a CMOS (Complementary Metal-Oxide-Semiconductor) logic gate?
In a half-wave rectifier, the input is a 50 Hz sine wave. What is the frequency of the ripple in the output voltage?
A counter is designed to count the sequence 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 0, 1... What is the modulus of this counter?

A disk has a seek time of 10 ms, a rotational speed of 7200 RPM, and a transfer rate of 20 MB/s. What is the approximate average time to read a 4 KB block? (Average rotational latency is half a rotation)
Two hosts, A and B, are on the same Ethernet LAN. Host A with IP 192.168.1.10 wants to send a packet to Host B with IP 192.168.1.20. Which protocol will Host A use to find the MAC address of Host B?
A 3D point (2, 3, 4) is scaled by a factor of (2, 1, 3) with respect to the origin. What are the new coordinates?
For a graph represented by an adjacency matrix, what is the time complexity to check if an edge exists between two vertices i and j?

choices.text: O(V+E) (where V is vertices, E is edges)

questions.text: In a demand-paging system, it takes 100 ns to access memory. If a page fault occurs, it takes 5 ms to service the fault. If the effective access time is 200 ns, what is the page fault rate?
An investment of Rs. 10,000 provides a return of Rs. 12,000 in one year. What is the simple rate of return?
Which of the following describes the relationship between a Book class and its Chapters in an object-oriented model?

choices.text: Aggregation (a book has chapters, but chapters could be considered separately)
Composition (a book is composed of chapters, and chapters cannot exist without the book)

questions.text: What is the key difference between a "compiler" and an "interpreter"?

choices.text: A compiler produces an executable file, while an interpreter executes source code line-by-line.
An interpreter is always faster than a compiler.
A compiler is used for scripting languages, and an interpreter is used for system languages.

questions.text: How many bits are required to represent 256 different characters?
A digital signal is required to transmit at 9600 bps. What is the minimum bandwidth required if the channel is noiseless and we use 4 signal levels?
The regular expression (a|b)*abb accepts which of the following strings?
In a game tree, the values at the leaf nodes represent the outcome for the MAX player. If a MAX node has two children with values 5 and 8, what value will be backed up to the MAX node?
Consider a Banker's algorithm scenario. If the Available resources are (1, 5, 2) and a process has a Need of (1, 2, 2), can this request be granted?

choices.text: Yes, because the system will remain in a safe state.
Cannot be determined without more information.

questions.text: What is the primary output of the Analysis phase in Object-Oriented Analysis and Design (OOAD)?

choices.text: A set of requirements, use cases, and a conceptual model
A detailed class diagram and system architecture
A's constructor, B's constructor, A's destructor, B's destructor
A's constructor, B's constructor, B's destructor, A's destructor
B's constructor, A's constructor, B's destructor, A's destructor

questions.text: A JK flip-flop has J=1, K=1. If the input clock has a frequency of 10 kHz, what is the frequency of the output Q?
Which of the following is a primary responsibility of the Nepal Engineering Council (NEC)?

choices.text: To maintain a register of qualified engineers and regulate their professional conduct.
To set the prices for engineering services.
To manage the Nepal Engineers' Association.
